Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <miketout> someone with Amazon's biggest servers maybe... anything's possible... just before time locks came on, i saw it get up to 18 GH/s briefly on the explorer, and we didn't have GPUs then for sure

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <miketout> i think two things are happening... one, we are getting a rise in hash power, and two, we are getting perceived higher hash power than it is sometimes when that happens because of compensation for POS. when it's an issue of compensation, it's not a bad thing, IMO at all. when they happen at the same time, it might look like a bigger burst than it is. i'm curious what we settle at.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <miketout> right now, it looks like we're already somewhat here/settled.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[KMD-Discord] <miketout> we're near final on the white paper, so if people like it, we might get a little busier soon. maybe it will calm down when we get to the 192 blocks. at least we'll also announce a bounty soon for some unlocked coins. reddit, twitter, and FB pages ready to open up as soon as we release the white paper. it would be great if people from the community could follow Verus on twitter, talk about the white paper on reddit, and like Verus on FB when that happens.
right now, i think we hit a rise due to combined incoming hash rate and POS. we will see a drop at the next block, I'm pretty sure.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <miketout> yes. i'd guess the real number is closer to 13-14 GH/s right now

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <miketout> we'll see in the next few blocks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <kamikraze> whats the code to point to single address across multiple machines again?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <kamikraze> can you point me to that?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <englal> Hmm - I'm not sure where or if it is documented. Just pass it a public key for an address you have in another wallet. You can get the pubkey using the validateaddress CLI/RPC command.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <englal> Ah, I don't believe pubkey works using cli/rpc. I believe verusd has to be invoked with the pupkey parameter in the command line or in the config file

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[KMD-Discord] <miketout> you need to set -pubkey=<66 char hex pubkey> when you first run verusd, so:
./verusd -gen -pubkey=<66 char hex pubkey>

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <englal> Hi @Norain, coins mined right now are time locked for a random number of blocks within a range. Immature blocks can't be spent or used for staking. The number next to mature tells you how long it will be until the transaction is unlocked, in blocks.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <Norain> so when i have coin in my balance

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <englal> Expand the Direction column so you can see the number next to immature.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <englal> Block, and the block time is 1 minute.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <englal> The range is from 3 months to 2 years and 3 months, approximately.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <englal> To give us a chance to reward early miners with large coinbases, create a community of those people who all have an itnerest in the coin succeeding, and prevent quick selloff of early coins.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <englal> They can't be spent by anyone, even the devs, as these are coins we all mine together.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [KMD-Discord] <englal> As soon as the block reward has dropped to 96 the newly mined coins won't be locked any more.
